column1: Most of these attacks are caused by gallstones in the gallbladder.
The disease occurs more often in women than in men.
Acute cholecystitis is a painful condition that leads to chronic cholecystitis.
It is not clear whether chronic cholecystitis causes any symptoms.
To diagnose diseases of the pancreas.
Tests that reveal gallstones or inflammation in the gallbladder include: - Abdominal CT scan - Abdominal ultrasound - Gallbladder scan (HIDA scan) - Oral cholecystogram
Surgery is the most common treatment.
If you are too ill to have surgery because of other diseases or conditions, the gallstones may be dissolved with medicine you take by mouth.
Complications may include: - Cancer of the gallbladder (rarely) - Jaundice - Pancreatitis - Worsening of the condition
Call your health care provider if you develop symptoms of cholecystitis.
